li.a: Apache Axis2 Service with Contract First Approach
Export Axis2 Service Project as Carbon Application Project(CApp)

body.p: To create a Apache Axis2 Service Project, open WSO2 Developer Studio Dashboard and select Axis2 Service Project from Service hosting category.
There are two options to create a axis2 service.

ol.li: Create New Axis2 Service using WSDL File

body.p: With the New Axis2 Service option, you will get an empty Axis2 service according to the information that you have provided. At the same time, you can upload a WSDL file from the file system.
If you select New Axis2 Service option, and click Next, wizard page will ask you general information like Project Name, package Name etc. Give necessary information and click Next.
In the next page, you can specifymaven information regarding the project or can allow the default information. and click Finish
After giving necessary information, click Finish. Now you will see that the created Axis2 Service Project and the service class has opened.
Now we will add a method to HelloService java class.
To generate WSDLfor a service, right click on the project and the select Generate WSDL from the right click menu
select a location to save the WSDL file
WSDL file will be created in the given location in the workspace.

To create a Apache Axis2 Client Project, goto File --> New --> Other will pop up a dialog box , go to WSO2 category then select service hosting category, under project types you can find the Axis2 Web Service Client Project.
There are three options to provide the WSDl file, can brows the wsdl file in the file system or workspace also can provide the uri of the wsdl file

After selecting the option, in the next wizard page, it will ask the source folder of the project, you can set the path for the source folder, you can do it using Browse button. After when you have a project in your workspace if you don't have project in the workspace you can create a new project using create new project link button, selecting the Source folder, click Next.
Select the necessary Client configuration Options available in the next page and click Finish.
Now you will see, client classes has been created in the selected Source folder that you have given previously.
You can generate an Axis2 Service Archive(.aar) by exporting the project. Right click on your Axis2 Service Project Select Export project as Deployable Archive from the menu.
This will pop up a dialog box. Then browse to the place where you want generate your Axis2 Archive file and click finish.
To create a Generate Axis2 Web Service Skeleton Project, open WSO2 Developer Studio Dashboard and select Generate Axis2 Web Service Skeleton Project from Service hosting category.

To create a Axis2 Web Service Skeleton Project, goto File --> New --> Other will pop up a dialog box , go to WSO2 category then select service hosting category, under project types you can find the Axis2 Web Service Skeleton Project.
There are threeoptions to provide the WSDl file, can brows the WSDL file in the file system or workspace also can provide the URI of the WSDL file

After selecting the option, in the next wizard page, it will ask the source folder of the project, you can set the path for the source folder, you can do it using Browse button. After when you have a project in your workspace if you don't have project in the workspace you can create a new project using create new project link button, selecting the Source folder, click Next.
Select the necessary configuration Options available in the next page and click Finish.
Now you will see, client classes has been created in the selected Source folder that you have given previously.
body.h2: Apache Axis2 Service with Contract First Approach
body.p: You can create an Apache Axis2 Service Project by pointing a WSDL file. This the second option avilable in Axis2 Service Project wizard
Select the necessary Client configaration Options available in the next page and click Finish.
Now you will see, new Web Services Project has been created which contains the generated stubs for the WSDL you have pointed.
body.h3: Export Axis2 Service Project as Carbon Application Project
body.p: you can group it with a Carbon Application Project and create the Carbon Application Archive [CAR] and deploy in to the Carbon Server.

To create a JAX-WS Service Project, Go to the J2EE perspective, and select File->New->Project and select WSO2 category, then under WSO2 category Service Hosting->Project Types->JAX-WS Service Project from the wizard dialog
There are two ways to create a JAX-WS Project.

ol.li: Create a JAX-WS Project using WSDL

body.p: With the first option, you can create a basic JAX-WS Project. You can develop a JAX-WS-enabled Web service as a Java class inside this project.
Once you create the JAX-WS project, to create a JAX-WS Service class, right click on the created JAX-WS project and go to New -> JAX-WS Service Class.
In the service creation class dialog, you will have to specify the bean class as well as the interface class. Give necessary information and click Finish.
Now you will see that the interface class and the bean class has been created inside the JAX-WS project that you have created.

With the Create New JAX-WS Service using WSDL File,you can generate a Web service from a WSDL file. The resulting Web service class will contain the public endpoint interface described by the WSDL without the implementation. After the Web service has been generated, you have to write Web service implementation class.
Browse for the correct WSDL file and you have to specify the CXF Home. You can download the CXF Binary Distribution and extract it. This will be your CXF Home.
Now you will see that the needed JAX-WS Service Classes have been generated.

You can export JAX-WS project as a web application (war) file or you can add it as dependency of Carbon Application project which can deploy on WSO2 Application Server.
To create a deployable archive (WAR) , Right-click on project, select Export Project as Deployable Archive, then choose destination location.

To create a JAX RESTful Web Service Project, Go to the J2EE perspective, and select File->New->Project and select WSO2 category, then under WSO2 category Service Hosting->Project Types->JAX RESTful Web Service Project from the wizard dialog
There are two options to create JAX RESTful service Project.

ol.li: Create a JAX-RS Project using WADL

body.p: With the first option, you can create a JAX RESTful service Project.
Once you create the JAX RESTful service project, to create a JAX RESTful service class, right click on the created JAX RESTful service project and go to New -> JAX RESTful Service Class.
In the service creation class dialog, you will have to specify the bean class as well as the interface class. Give necessary information and click Finish.
Now you will see that the interface class and the bean class has been created inside the JAX RESTful service project project that you have created.

You can also create a JAX RESTful service project by pointing a WADL file. This is the second option avilable in JAX RESTful service Project wizard.Browse for the correct WADL file and you have to specify the CXF Home. You can download the CXF Binary Distribution and extract it. This will be your CXF Home.

You can export JAX RESTful service project as a web application (war) file or you can add it as dependency of Carbon Application project which can deploy on WSO2 Application Server.
To create a deployable archive (WAR) , Right-click on project, select Export Project as Deployable Archive, then choose destination location.
